get.summary: Retrieve a stream of an instance's logs
get.description: Retrieve a stream of logs generated by a workload instance's containers. Logs are generated by the container themselves and are not modified by StackPath. Log contents vary by the application running in the container, though many containerized applications are configured to log to STDOUT and STDERR.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: stack_id
parameters.description: The ID of the stack containing the workload whose instances to retrieve

parameters.name: workload_id
parameters.description: The ID the workload whose instances to retrieve

parameters.name: instance_name
parameters.description: The name of the instance to obtain logs for

parameters.name: container_name
parameters.description: The name of the container to obtain logs for. This defaults to first container in instance.

parameters.name: follow
parameters.description: Whether or not to follow the instance's log stream. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Whether or not to return log entries made by previously terminated containers. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: since_seconds
parameters.description:
A relative time in seconds before the current time from which to show logs. If this value precedes the time an instance was started, only logs since the instance's start time will be returned. If this value is in the future, no logs will be returned.

Only one of since_seconds or since_time may be specified

parameters.name: since_time
parameters.description:
An RFC3339 timestamp from which to show logs. If this value precedes the time an instance was started, only logs since the instance's start time will be returned. If this value is in the future, no logs will be returned.

Only one of since_seconds or since_time may be specified

parameters.name: timestamps
parameters.description: Whether or not to add an RFC3339 or RFC3339Nano timestamp at the beginning of every line of log output. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: tail_lines
parameters.description: The number of lines from the end of the logs to show. If not specified, logs are shown from the creation of the container or since_seconds or since_time.

parameters.name: limit_bytes
parameters.description: The number of bytes to read from the server before terminating log output. This may not display a complete final line of logging, and may return slightly more or slightly less than the specified limit.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

post.description: The action is performed asynchronously and a successful response does not mean the instance has restarted yet.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.
Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

exitCode.title: The exit code of the command that started the container

message.title: A more detailed explanation of a container's termination

unixTime.title: The time that a data point was recorded

DataVector.title: A set of time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

GetMetricsRequestGroupBy.title: The available fields to group instance metrics by

MetricsData.title: The data points in a metrics collection

 - UNBOUND: The volume claim is unbound

totalCount.title: The total number of items in the dataset

hasNextPage.title: Whether or not another page of data is available

endCursor.title: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

warnings.title: Warnings encountered when querying for metrics

drop.title: List of supported capabilities to drop from container

v1ContainerImagePullPolicy.title: The image pull policy for the container image. The value should be one of ALWAYS or IF_NOT_PRESENT

v1ContainerLifecycle.title: Defines actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events

readOnlyRootFilesystem.title: Indicates whether this container has a read-only root filesystem

allowPrivilegeEscalation.title: Controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process

v1ContainerSecurityContext.title: Security configuration that will be applied to a container

image.title: The location of a Docker image to run as a container

command.title: The commands that start a container

args.title: Arguments to the container entry point

volumeMounts.title: Volumes to mount in the container

terminationMessagePath.title: Mounted file path at which the container's termination message will be written

v1ContainerSpec.title: The specification for the desired state of a container in a workload

v1ContainerSpecMapEntry.title: A string to container configuration key/value pair

v1ContainerStatus.title: The status of a container in a workload

v1ContainerStatusContainerPhase.description:
- CONTAINER_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: The container has not reported a state back or StackPath is unable to determine the container's state

deprecationDate.description: Deprecated images may still be used when creating instances, but users will want to upgrade.

- IMAGE_STATUS_UNKNOWN: The image status is unknown

 - PROCESSING: The image is processing
 - READY: The image is ready
 - FAILED: The image failed to be created
v1ImageStatus.title: Which capture status an image is currently in

fieldPath.description: This is a json path expression to an instance field. For example: `.name`, `.location.cityCode`, `.ipAddress`, `.containers[0].image`, `.networkInterfaces[?(@.network=="default")].gateway`.  Dots inside of map keys need to be escaped: `.metadata.labels['workload\.platform\.stackpath\.net/workload-slug']`. Recursive descent, union operators, and range/end are not allowed.
fieldPath.title: The json path to an instance field

optional.description: If a field is optional there is no guarantee that the value will be provided to the environment before the container starts.
optional.title: If the field value is not required to start an instance

v1InstanceFieldRef.title: The reference to a field on an instance

protocol.description: Values are either "TCP" or "UDP". Defaults to "TCP".
protocol.title: The network protocol for the port

enableImplicitNetworkPolicy.description: When true, this port will be given an implicit network policy of priority 65534 permitting 0.0.0.0/0 access to the port. This can be overridden by creating network policies of a higher priority to block the port.
enableImplicitNetworkPolicy.title: Allow the internet to connect to the port

v1InstancePort.title: A named port for an instance of a workload

v1InstancePortMapEntry.title: A string to network port key/value pair

slug.title: The slug of the volume claim to mount

mountPath.title: The path in an instance to mount a volume

v1InstanceVolumeMount.title: Describes mounting a volume on containers or vms in an instance

key.title: The name of the selector to perform a match against

operator.title: The operation to perform to match a selector

values.title: The values to match in the selector

v1MatchExpression.title: An expression to match selectors against a set of values

createdAt.title: The date that a metadata entry was created

updatedAt.title: The date that a metadata entry was last updated

deleteRequestedAt.title: The date an entity was requested to be deleted

version.description: Metadata versions start at 1 when they are created and increment by 1 every time they are updated.
version.title: A metadata entry's version number

averageValue.description: The target average value for the metric measured across all instances within a deployment, expressed as a quantity.

averageUtilization.description: The target average value for the metric measured across all instances within a deployment, expressed as a percentage of requested resources.

ipFamilies.description: This is an optional property and supports ['IPv4'] or ['IPv4', 'IPv6'] list
ipFamilies.title: A list of IP families to use for interface ip assignments

subnet.description: An IPv4 subnet interface's slug. This is an optional property used to attach a specific network interface to a IPv4 subnet.

ipv6Subnet.description: An IPv6 subnet interface's slug. This is an optional property used to attach a specific network interface to a ipv6 subnet.

enableOneToOneNat.description: This is an optional property used to enable OR disable the NAT'ing of the specifc network interface.NAT is enabled by default on the first / primary interface and disabled on secondary / multi interfacesUser can disable NAT on the first / primary interface, by marking this property - falseUser can enable NAT on secondary / multi interface, by marking this property - trueExcludeNAT Annotation supercedes this property
enableOneToOneNat.title: Provide one to one NAT for this specific network’s interface

v1NetworkInterface.title: Network interfaces that will be created on instances in the workload

initialDelaySeconds.title: The number of seconds after a workload instance has started before liveness probes are initiated

timeoutSeconds.description: Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1.
timeoutSeconds.title: The number of seconds after which a probe times out

periodSeconds.description: Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.
periodSeconds.title: How often, in seconds, to perform a probe

successThreshold.description: Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness. Minimum value is 1.
successThreshold.title: The minimum consecutive successes for a probe to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.title: The minimum consecutive failures for a probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

v1Probe.title: A health check probe against a workload instance to determine if it is alive or ready to receive traffic

v1PutWorkloadRequest.title: A request to replace an existing workload

v1PutWorkloadResponse.title: A response from a request to replace an existing workload

v1ResourceRequirements.description:
Resource requirements are key/value pairs.

Resource requirements for an object. The values supported by workloads are:
- cpu
- memory
- nvidia-a16: limited to specific markets
- ephemeral-storage: deprecated and has no effect

metrics.description: Metrics to observe for invoking scaling events.

v1StringMapEntry.title: A string to string key/value pair

v1Sysctl.title: Kernel sysctl parameter to optimize the performance of a container

v1TCPSocketAction.title: Connect to an instance's TCP port

v1Target.title: How instances in a workload should be deployed

v1TargetMapEntry.title: A string to deployment target key/value pair

deploymentScope.title: The scope at which a deployment should be created. Valid values are: "cityCode"

volumeMounts.title: Volumes to mount in the virtual machine

reason.title: A short reason why the virtual machine is in its current phase

message.title: A longer message with details about why the virtual machine is in its current phase

v1VirtualMachineStatus.title: The status of a Virtual Machine

name.title: A volume claim's name as it appears in the StackPath portal

name.title: A workload's name as it appears in the StackPath portal

slug.description: Workload slugs are used to build its instances names
slug.title: A workload's programmatic name

v1Workload.description: Workloads define a computing application to deploy to StackPath's edge network.
v1Workload.title: A computing workload

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.title: The duration in seconds the workload instance needs to terminate gracefully. The value should belong to [0-300] seconds range

shareProcessNamespace.title: Whether to run all containers of workload instance in a single process namespace

hostAliases.title: The list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the workload instance's hosts file

v1WorkloadInstanceContainerRuntimeSettin.title: The specification for container settings which are applicable to all workload instance containers

v1WorkloadInstanceRuntimeSettings.title: The specification for workload instance level settings

runAsUser.title: The user UID to run the entry point of the container process

runAsGroup.title: The user GID to run the entry point of the container process

runAsNonRoot.title: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user

supplementalGroups.title: The additional list of user groups applied to the first process run in each container running in the workload instance

sysctls.title: The list of kernel sysctl parameters to optimize the performance of a containersupported sysctls are [kernel.msgmax, kernel.msgmnb, kernel.pid_max, kernel.shmall, kernel.shmmax, kernel.shm_rmid_forced, net.core.netdev_budget, net.core.netdev_budget_usecs, net.core.netdev_max_backlog, net.core.optmem_max, net.core.rmem_default, net.core.rmem_max, net.core.somaxconn, v1WorkloadInstanceSecurityContext.title: Security configuration that will be applied to all containers in the workload instance

hostAliases.title: The list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the workload instance's hosts file

v1WorkloadInstanceVMRuntimeSettings.title: The specification for VM settings which are applicable to VM workload instance

networkInterfaces.title: Network interfaces to bind to the workload's instances

volumeClaimTemplates.description: The slug of the claim will be used in combination with the name of the instance to create a stable identifier. The slug should be used in the volume mount specifications for containers and VMs.
volumeClaimTemplates.title: A list of claims that instances may reference

v1WorkloadSpec.title: The specification for the desired state of a workload

v1WorkloadStatus.description:
- ACTIVE: The workload is active
 - SUSPENDED: The workload is suspended
 - BILLING_SUSPENDED: The workload is suspended due to non-payment
 - INACTIVE: The workload is inactive or has been deleted
v1WorkloadStatus.title: Which status a workload is currently in

v1WrappedImagePullCredentials.title: The credentials that should be used to pull the container image

stackId.title: The ID of the stack that an instance belongs to

workloadId.title: The ID of the workload that an instance belongs to

name.description: Instance names are generated from their corresponsing workload's slug, followed by a unique hash
name.title: An instance's name

externalIpAddress.title: An instance's publicly accessible IPv4 address

externalIpv6Address.title: An instance's publicly accessible IPv6 address

createdAt.title: The date an instance was created

startedAt.title: The date an instance was started

deletedAt.title: The date an instance was deleted

containerStatuses.title: Status of the containers running within the workload instance

initContainerStatuses.title: Status of the init_containers running within the workload instance

virtualMachineStatuses.title: The status of the virtual machines running within the workload instance

reason.title: A short reason that explains why an instance is in a phase

message.title: A longer message that provides more detail on why an instance is in a phase

scheduledAt.title: The date an instance was scheduled

workloadv1Instance.title: An instance of a workload deployment

workloadv1InstanceInstancePhase.description:
- INSTANCE_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: StackPath is unable to determine the instance's startup state
 - STARTING: The instance is still initializing
 - RUNNING: The instance is running
 - FAILED: The instance failed to start
 - COMPLETED: The instance finished running
 - SCHEDULING: The instance is being scheduled
 - STOPPED: The instance is stopped
 - DELETING: The instance is being deleted
workloadv1InstanceInstancePhase.title: An instance's startup state

cityCode.title: A location's city, expressed as an IATA airport code

countryCode.title: A location's ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 country code

ipAddress.title: A network interface's primary IPv4 address

ipAddressAliases.title: Additional IPv4 addresses bound to a network interface

gateway.title: A network interface's IPv4 gateway address

ipv6Address.title: A network interface's primary IPv6 address

ipv6AddressAliases.title: Additional IPv6 addresses bound to a network interface

ipv6Gateway.title: A network interface's IPv6 gateway address

workloadv1NetworkInterfaceStatus.title: Network interfaces that are attached to an instance in a workload
